Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We are going to model the described process. The steps are: 1. Claim Registration (CR) 2. Document Verification (DV) - If documents are incomplete, we go to Re-Document Submission (RDS) and then back to DV. 3. Fraud Check (FC) - If doubts, we go to In-depth Investigation (II) and then back to FC (can happen multiple times). 4. Claim Assessment (CA) 5. Approval (AP) 6. Payment (P) 7. Notification (N) 8. Closure (CL).

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: For the approval, it says if the amount surpasses a certain threshold. However, in the process description, its listed as a step. To simplify, we can assume that every claim goes through AP.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Places: p_start: initial place p_after_CR: after claim registration p_after_DV: after document verification From p_after_DV: t_FC to p_after_FC t_RDS to p_before_DV.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: After DV, the next activity is either FC (if documents are complete) or RDS (if incomplete). So p_after_DV -> t_FC -> p_after_FC p_after_DV -> t_RDS -> p_before_DV.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We need to merge the two flows. Have a place p_before_FC. Both after DV (complete) and after II put a token there. Then t_FC has p_before_FC as its only input place.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: If we set t_FC: input p2, output p3. t_II: input p3, output p2. t_RDS: input p2, output p1. Then after II we put a token in p2, and then from p2 we can fire t_FC or t_RDS. That is not correct because after II, we should directly go to FC, not have the option to go to RDS.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: p2: after DV. From p2, two transitions: t_route: p2 -> p_before_FC (invisible) t_RDS: p2 -> p1 t_FC: p_before_FC -> p3 t_II: p3 -> p_before_FC.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Start: token in p0. CR fires: to p1. DV fires: to p2. From p2, choose t_route: to p_before_FC, then t_FC to p3. From p3, choose t_II: to p_before_FC, then t_FC to p3. Or from p3 t_CA to p4 etc. This seems correct.
